ratings.question_text: Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.

What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: This course is an excellent introduction to Italian literature and culture from the Duecento to the Renaissance. It provides a good survey of Italian literature during this period and is also a good opportunity for students to improve their Italian grammar and vocabulary.

Topics covered include the history of Italian literature until the 1500s and an overview of the literary texts of the period. Component of the class focuses on developing stronger writing skills in Italian.
I learned how to read and analyze texts in Italian. I also learned about the cultural history and literature of Italy through the Renaissance.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: This course covers a lot of different texts from the Duecento to the Renaissance. We learned about some of the most famous works from this period as well as some works that are lesser known. It was nice to learn about so many different works in the course. However, I sometimes wished we could have spent longer analyzing certain texts.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I thought that Simona used breakout rooms very well! The breakout rooms allowed us to converse with our peers and were always very interesting. Simona also sent us virtual files that we could use for our discussions. Overall, I thought that Simona used technology well when teaching this course. The only moments where this course did not feel as strong as an in-person model were moments where we otherwise would have been on field trips; however, I do not think this could be improved.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I would definitely recommend this course. I thought this was a really thorough introduction to Italian literature. It also was a great way to practice speaking, reading, writing, and understanding Italian. The assignments were also very manageable while still being interesting.
